key_risks: Class action lawsuits related to misleading packaging
Litigation with competitors over prescription diversion
Supply chain disruptions impacting inventory and delivery
Intense competition from major players like Amazon and Walmart
Profitability pressures due to high operating costs
controversies: $5M class action lawsuit for misleading packaging
Lawsuits against Vetcove and Covetrus for alleged conspiracy
Violation of the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
environmental_issues: Potential disruptions from severe weather events
Need for sustainable packaging and eco-friendly initiatives
social_issues: Privacy concerns and potential fines under CCPA
Reputational damage from legal and financial risks
governance_issues: Management of legal and financial liabilities

sources.title: Is Chewy Ethical? An In-Depth Analysis of the Pet E-Commerce Giant
sources.snippet: However, some question the sustainability and ethics of Chewy's growth-at-all-costs model. The company has yet to turn a profit, losing $92 million in 2020 even as net sales jumped 47%. Chewy also holds $2.4 billion in debt after being acquired by PetSmart in 2017 for $3.35 billion, the highest price ever paid for an e-commerce site.
